benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Retrieve payment custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios (TC01-03, TC16) verify successful retrieval with different audit parameter values and default behavior.
Empty Response: TC04 and TC19 cover behavior when a payment has no custom fields (including regression case that previously returned 500).
Query Parameters: Tests for valid audit values (FULL, MINIMAL, NONE), malformed audit (TC25), extra/ignored params (TC05) are present.
Authorization: Unauthorized scenarios are covered for missing and invalid tokens (TC08, TC09) returning 401.

Input Validation & Error Handling: Invalid UUID format (TC06), syntactically valid but non-existent ID (TC07), trailing spaces/special chars/SQLi/XSS attempts (TC13, TC14, TC20, TC21) are covered with expected 400/404 responses.
Dependency & Service Errors: Service unavailable (TC10) and dependent service failure (TC17) are included.
Performance & Load: Response-time threshold (TC12), large payload (1000 items) (TC11), concurrent requests (TC24), and retry behavior for transient failures (TC15) are included.
Data Consistency: Newly added custom field visibility is covered (TC18).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination parameters (limit/offset/page) or pagination headers even though a large dataset is present. The API spec does not list pagination but guidelines require verifying it for large datasets.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios verify cache-related headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GETs (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests verify rate-limit responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under burst traffic beyond normal concurrency tests.
Authorization: No tests for authorization-related 403 (forbidden) cases — e.g., valid token but lacking required permissions/roles.

Response Schema Validation: While success responses are asserted as JSON arrays of CustomField objects, there are no explicit schema/body field-level validations (required fields, types, audit field structure).
Pagination-related Performance: TC11 verifies large count but does not test memory/streaming/pagination implications or server-side cutoffs for extremely large datasets beyond 1000 items.
Caching + Audit Combination: No tests that exercise interactions between audit parameter and caching (e.g., different audit levels affecting cacheability).
recommendations: Add pagination tests (if API supports it): request with limit/offset/page parameters, verify correct slicing, pagination headers (Link, X-Total-Count), and behavior when requesting beyond last page.
Add caching tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control presence, perform conditional GETs (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and expect 304 where appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts to ensure 429 responses and appropriate Retry-After headers are enforced.
Add authorization/permission tests that assert 403 responses when an authenticated user lacks necessary permissions or scope.
Add strict response-schema validations: assert required fields and types for each CustomField object (id, objectType, fieldName, fieldValue, audit details) for each audit level.
Extend large dataset and performance tests to include streaming/pagination boundaries and server behavior for extremely large payloads (10k+, depending on expected scale).
Add tests that combine audit parameter values with caching behavior to ensure sensitive audit data is not improperly cached.
